did.abstract: The Coalition for Student Rights at New York University (NYU) was formed in 1981 to seek greater student participation in institutional decision making at NYU. This collection consists of organization materials, including newsletters, a bill of rights, and student surveys.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged in their original order.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Coalition for Student Rights at New York University (NYU) was formed in 1981 to seek greater student participation in institutional decision making at NYU. Specifically, the coalition sought more student representation on decision making bodies and greater involvement in grading policies, budget formulation, financial aid decisions, faculty and staff hiring, student housing, minority recruitment, and placement.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.

userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of organizational records of the Coalition for Student Rights at NYU. Record types include newsletter galleys and articles, flyers, and survey forms.
